clinical_study.brief_title: Connected to Care: Use of Mobile Short Message Services to Improve HPV Care
clinical_study.official_title: Connected to Care: Use of Mobile Short Message Services to Improve HPV Care - A Randomised Control Trial Among HPV-positive Tanzanian Women

brief_summary.textblock: This study evaluates the effect of the mobile phone intervention 'Connected to Care' on the attendance rate to cervical cancer screening check-up appointments.

detailed_description.textblock: Connected to Care is a two-site RCT (Randomised Clinical Trial), in which the effect of an mHealth intervention is compared to standard of care in a group of women who are undergoing VIA (Visual Inspection with Acetic Acid) and are tested for HR (High-Risk) HPV (Human Papilomavirus). Post testing, HPV-positive women receive a home visit by a community health worker where they are informed about the result of their HPV-test and invited to a check-up appointment 12 months later. In the 12-month period that follows, the intervention group receives mHealth (Mobile Health) messages about cervical cancer and how it can be prevented by regular screening; quizzes based on the mHealth messages; and sms-reminders for the check-up appointment. The primary hypothesis is that the intervention increases the attendance rate with 15%. The effect of the intervention is 12-month check-up attendance rates for HR HPV-positive women (both intervention and control group).

primary_outcome.measure: Effect of mHealth messages on attendance rate to check-up appointment
primary_outcome.description: To assess the effect of mHealth messages, mHealth quizzes, and sms-reminders on HPV-positive women's attendance to check-up appointments at 12 months compared to standard of care.

arm_group.description: mHealth (Mobile Health) messages about cervical cancer and how it can be prevented by regular screening; mobile quizzes based on mHealth messages; and sms-reminders for check-up appointment. Period of 12 months.

intervention.description: mHealth messages sent on month -12, -10, -6, -5, -3. mHealth quizzes sent on month -9, -4, -2. Sms-reminders of check-up appointment sent on days -30, -7 days, -1, +1, +7.

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
- HPV-positive
- Able to give informed consent
Exclusion Criteria:
- Do not have access to a mobile phone/ cannot provide a phone number
